content: the root of this bug is sort of amazing, that contract is meant to just send eth to a list of contracts,  it's a function that takes a list of addresses and a list of amounts, they wanted to send eth to 10 address, so sent an array of length 10 for addresses and 10 for the amounts, however when they ABI encoded it they encoded it as 0x10 not 0xa for 10, so they read past the list of address, it happens that the list length is 0x10, so they try to send 0 eth to that address

author: sorpaas

author: sorpaas
content: So think of it as also a sort of spec issue instead of a standalone consensus bug.

author: sorpaas
content: tldr, no fuzzing can catch this bug unless OE used a different test spec.

author: jochembrouwer
content: https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/811/files ?? Or are we talking about different things here?

author: sorpaas
content: Talking about the OE bug post mortem

author: sorpaas
content: The thing is, no matter what tests you add or what fuzzing you do, it's always ran against the test spec.

author: sorpaas
content: As a result they'll all pass. And things will still only fail on mainnet.

author: sorpaas
content: The lesson here is that to avoid this from happening again, Ethereum dev community must make it so that tests can be ran against mainnet spec **directly** next time. Having separate test spec and mainnet spec is the main reason why the bug today wasn't caught earlier.

author: sorpaas
content: Without the above, it does not work no matter how extensive testing and fuzzing have been done.

author: timbeiko
content: What stops us from doing that, technically?

author: sorpaas
content: ~~Nothing, but it just wasn't done, at least not in OE.~~

author: sorpaas
content: Probably increased CI time and extra development effort, since it needs to take into consideration of the whole mainnet genesis block, and will probably have to fake block numbers so that it passes the activation block.

author: sorpaas
content: I don't think any of the client team is doing this since it requires probably faking millions of blocks in each test. Or probably we have to ignore something and don't build blocks from genesis.
